Author: astankova
Text: It’s a constant bombarding that is so draining yet at the same time so fascinating. I can feel myself being tired, but I can’t stop because it is so interesting to me and I’m curious and I want to keep knowing. It’s like all of this consuming is a replacement for eating.

Author: sunshinelovesunday
Text: One of the worst/best things to me about having a restrictive ED is never being able to think of anything else. Ever.  Count calories, weigh food, check BMI, look at other people's BMI in other countries, compare, TDEE, losertown, mybodygallery, youtube "what I eat in a day", google "how to water fast for 90 days" "how to make water taste like food" "how to lose 30 pounds in 1 month" "how long can i live without food" "how to not be hungry" count more calories, meal plan all day. It never ends.  It's a blessing as far as a distraction, and also a curse because, I would like a life. I have children. I'd like to play grocery store without counting the calories of imaginary cake mix.
